page.title: 04RAMS HILL HOUSE
page.content: Rams Hill House This house now gives its name to a Hamlet which is about half a mile away The hamlet contains several houses most of which were built no earlier than 1900 Corner House The Corner Horsmonden This house was originally a weavers house dating from about 1500 and was thatched with no chimney the smoke escaped through a hole in the roof This property now has a tiled roof Westenhanger This is another house believed to be even older Horsmonden Housing towards the village from Rams Hill comprises Council Properties some of which are now privately owned and several timber framed houses including an Oast House used as living accommodation
